channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-16532] Procedure-V2: Enforce procedure ownership at submission
item.description:
HBASE-16520 (for TableBackupProcedure) and HBASE-16528 (for ServerCrashProcedure) were two recent JIRAs where procedure ownership is set at time of construction.

This JIRA continues the discussion toward the end of HBASE-16520.

Proposal is to enforce procedure ownership for all the procedures.
item.summary: Procedure-V2: Enforce procedure ownership at submission

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Tentative patch.

There're procedures in tests which need to be modified.

I'd like to have the flag "hbase.procedure.check.owner.set" and have it set to false in hbase-procedure/test/resources/hbase-site.xml at least the basic tests doesn't have to set that.
other stuff will have it to true and fail.

+1 overall

This message was automatically generated.
+1 on v2, maybe change the name in CHECK_OWNER_SET_CONF_KEY just to look similar to the other conf property we have around
Waiting for HBASE-16528 to be integrated before running QA on the next patch.
sorry, another little thing instead of (proc.getOwner() != null) in the precondition let's use proc.hasOwner().

I have no problem for this patch to go in. By the way, is it possible that 1.x ServerCrashProcedure upgrade to later version and hit this check?

However, I think we probably should improve in this part of code. Today, (1). we have to repeat the setOwner code this.setOwner(env.getRequestUser().getShortName()); in ALL procedure constructor; and (2) we have to store required UserInformation user_info = 1; in all procedures that run coprocessor inside procedure (those repeated this.user = env.getRequestUser();, .setUserInfo(MasterProcedureUtil.toProtoUserInfo(this.user)), user = MasterProcedureUtil.toUserInfo(state.getUserInfo()); code). Code duplication is one major problem for software development, the 2 JIRAs mentioned in this JIRA shows that

My suggestion is to simplify this: instead of all those duplicate code, in ProcedureExecutor<TEnvironment> class, we should set procedure owner information in submitProcedure(). Therefore, we put code in one place and there is no need to duplicate or maybe forget to duplicate these logic in the future. (note: upgrade might be a problem if we removes user_info in protobuf)

submit procedure is not the right place to put it. since hbase-procedure module has no knowledge about rpc or other hbase related things. maybe we can create a base class or helpers, but as far as I know you can't have an interface for generated messages of protobuf and storing the user info will be on each message.

I don't see MasterProcedureEnv referenced in ProcedureExecutor currently.

Saw Matteo's comment after hitting Save.

I agree with Matteo.
compatibility is not a problem because the 1.x stuff that is in the wal will never go through submit() again. so it will not hit the check.
Trivial change in CreateTableProcedure to trigger QA run.

-1 overall
